title: Noise
data:
***Version [0.14](/0.14 "0.14")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

- Note: *Severely* outdated. Noise now spreads in a square, many branches have been changed, noise meter added

**Noise** in the dungeon can wake [sleeping](/Sleep "Sleep") monsters. Monsters that hear a sound will generally wander toward it; if you get involved in a fight, monsters can come from all different directions to see what the fuss is about, potentially overwhelming you.

## Contents

- [1 Noise propagation](#Noise_propagation)

- [2 Ambient noise](#Ambient_noise)

- [3 Sources of noise](#Sources_of_noise)

  - [3.1 Melee combat](#Melee_combat)

    - [3.1.1 Calculation of noise\_factor](#Calculation_of_noise_factor)
    - [3.1.2 Auxiliary attacks](#Auxiliary_attacks)

  - [3.2 Ranged combat](#Ranged_combat)

  - [3.3 Spell noise](#Spell_noise)

  - [3.4 Player shouts](#Player_shouts)

  - [3.5 Other sources](#Other_sources)

- [4 History](#History)

## Noise propagation

When a noisy action happens at a position, the noise will propagate to all the adjacent cells. Each time it advances a cell, the intensity suffers an attenuation. When the intensity reaches a value less than 1, the noise is inaudible and it won't propagate further.

The attenuation depends on the following factors:

- The cell type:

| Cell type          | Attenuation |
| ------------------ | ----------- |
| Empty              | -0.85       |
| Statue or Idol     | -1.70       |
| Tree or Mangrove   | -2.55       |
| Closed/Secret door | -6.80       |
| Wall               | -10.20      |
| Permanent wall     | -infinity   |

- The direction: In diagonal, the attenuation is 41% higher (sqrt(2)\~1.41).

This means that in open areas the radius of the area affected by a noise is: loudness/0.85 = loudness\*1.176.

The following picture was generated by compiling the game with the option DEBUG\_NOISE\_PROPAGATION enabled. It shows which squares are affected by a simple shout. In this case, the intensity was 12 and the ambient noise was 0.

[![Noise grid example.png](/images/c/c5/Noise_grid_example.png)](/File:Noise_grid_example.png)

## Ambient noise

Ambient noise makes sounds harder to hear. This idea is implemented in the game by adding, or subtracting, a branch-specific amount to *loudness*. The effective loudness is:

```
effective_loudness = loudness - sgn(ambient_noise)×{3d(abs(ambient_noise))/3 - 1}
```

| Branch                                                        | Ambient noise |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------- |
| [The Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon")                     | 0             |
| The [Temple](/Temple "Temple")                                | 0             |
| The [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines")              | 0             |
| The [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls")                 | 0             |
| [The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair")                              | 0             |
| [The Snake Pit](/The_Snake_Pit "The Snake Pit")               | 0             |
| [The Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp")                           | 0             |
| [The Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals")                        | 3             |
| [The Spider's Nest](/The_Spider%27s_Nest "The Spider's Nest") | 0             |
| [The Slime Pits](/The_Slime_Pits "The Slime Pits")            | -5            |
| [The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths")                        | 0             |
| [The Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults")                        | 0             |
| [Hall of Blades](/Hall_of_Blades "Hall of Blades")            | -7            |
| [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")                           | -3            |
| [The Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb")                              | -10           |
| [The Hells](/Hell "Hell")                                     | 0             |
| [The Realm of Zot](/The_Realm_of_Zot "The Realm of Zot")      | 0             |
| [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium")                     | 0             |
| [Portals](/Portals "Portals")                                 | 0             |

In most branches, this effect is minimal. Certain branches, however (the [Tomb](/Tomb "Tomb") in particular), greatly amplify even the slightest noise. While characters in heavy armour probably won't care, stealthy characters that are used to sneaking around will find that even the noise generated by their attacks attracts attention.

## Sources of noise

### Melee combat

A successful stabbing is always silent, otherwise the loudness is:

```
 noise_factor * damage_done / 400
```

This value is capped at 12. Noise is generated even if you miss your attack (in that case loudness is 1).

Other sources of noise in melee combat:

- [Auxiliary attacks](#Auxiliary_attacks)
- Noisy [randarts](/Randart "Randart"): 20 (1 chance in 20)
- Attacking with a weapon of [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos"): 15 (1 chance in 200)

#### Calculation of noise\_factor

The base value of noise\_factor depends on the damage type of your weapon: 150 for [unarmed combat](/Unarmed_combat "Unarmed combat"); 125 for slashing or crushing; 100 for slicing or chopping; 75 for piercing or stabbing. If your weapon has multiple damage types, the game will chose one of them randomly (you can look up the damage types of any weapon [here](/Weapon#Weapon_details "Weapon")).

#### Auxiliary attacks

If you get an [auxiliary attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"), that attack also makes noise and its noise factor is:

| Auxiliary Attack   | noise\_factor                                                                              |
| ------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Constriction       | 10                                                                                         |
| Kick               | 100                                                                                        |
| Headbutt           | 100                                                                                        |
| Beak               | 75                                                                                         |
| Tail Slap, Stinger | 125                                                                                        |
| Punch, Claws       | 100 (75 if [Blade Hands](/Blade_Hands "Blade Hands") is active; 125 if you have tentacles) |
| Bite               | 75                                                                                         |
| Pseudopods         | 125                                                                                        |
| Tentacles          | 100                                                                                        |

### Ranged combat

There are two sources of noise when you shoot a projectile: the launcher and the missile.

The noise generated by the launcher is always made at your position even if you miss the shot.

| Launcher                                              | Loudness |
| ----------------------------------------------------- | -------- |
| None (i.e. [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing"))          | 0        |
| [Blowgun](/Blowgun "Blowgun")                         | 0        |
| [Hunting sling](/Hunting_sling "Hunting sling")       | 1        |
| [Greatsling](/Greatsling "Greatsling")                | 3        |
| [Shortbow](/Shortbow "Shortbow")                      | 5        |
| [Longbow](/Longbow "Longbow")                         | 6        |
| [Hand crossbow](/Hand_crossbow "Hand crossbow")       | 2        |
| [Arbalest](/Arbalest "Arbalest")                      | 7        |
| [Triple crossbow](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow") | 9        |

The noise generated by the missile itself depends on the base damage of the item. It is damage/3, rounded down. It is generated at the last square it reached, even if doesn't hit anything.

| Missile                                      | Loudness |
| -------------------------------------------- | -------- |
| [Tomahawk](/Tomahawk "Tomahawk")             | 2        |
| [Javelin](/Javelin "Javelin")                | 3        |
| [Large rock](/Large_rock "Large rock")       | 7        |
| [Throwing net](/Throwing_net "Throwing net") | 0        |
| [Needle](/Needle "Needle")                   | 0        |
| [Stone](/Stone "Stone")                      | 1        |
| [Sling bullet](/Sling_bullet "Sling bullet") | 2        |
| [Arrow](/Arrow "Arrow")                      | 2        |
| [Bolt](/Bolt "Bolt")                         | 3        |

Example: A character with a bow shoots an arrow. The destination is an empty cell. (Note that this image is out of date. The arrow would make 1 more noise in recent versions.)

[![Noise-grid-ranged-combat.png](/images/c/c2/Noise-grid-ranged-combat.png)](/File:Noise-grid-ranged-combat.png)

### Spell noise

See [spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise").

### Player shouts

- 12 in normal conditions.
- 18 in [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form").
- 8 in [Spider Form](/Spider_Form "Spider Form")
- 4 in [Bat Form](/Bat_Form "Bat Form")
- 14 if you have level 2 of the [scream](/Bad_mutations#Scream "Bad mutations") mutation.
- 16 if you have level 3 of the [scream](/Bad_mutations#Scream "Bad mutations") mutation.

### Other sources

- [Qazlal](/Qazlal "Qazlal") worshipper at piety \*\*\*\*\*\*: 16
- [Scroll of noise](/Scroll_of_noise "Scroll of noise"): 25
- The [Singing Sword](/Singing_Sword "Singing Sword"): 0-35 depending on [tension](/Tension "Tension").
- Blocking an attack with the [Shield of the Gong](/Shield_of_the_Gong "Shield of the Gong"): 40
- Monster shouts
- Monster spells with the [Noisy flag](/Spell_slot_flag "Spell slot flag")
- Creaking doors: 10 (1 chance in [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") + [Traps](/Traps "Traps") + [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth")/2; "As you open/close the door, it creaks loudly!")
- [Alarm traps](/Alarm_trap "Alarm trap"): 40
- Using the [Horn of Geryon](/Horn_of_Geryon "Horn of Geryon"): 15

## History

Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), the Lair's ambient noise was 4, and the Orcish Mines's was 3

Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), the Crypt's ambient noise was -20.
